Data.cxSPmean: 预付款;常指军事行动中的）前进;在某科目、某活动中的）发展;改善;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:advances

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An advance is money lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: She was paid a 100,000 dollars advance for her next two novels.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她得到了其接下来的两本小说的10万美元的预付款。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]（常指军事行动中的）前进
meanCollection.englishMeaning: An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.

senCollection.sentenceEn: In an exercise designed to be as real as possible, they simulated an advance on enemy positions.
senCollection.sTranslation: 在一次设计得尽可能逼真的演习中，他们模拟了一次向敌方阵地的前进。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Advance in the jungle was very slow.
senCollection.sTranslation: 在丛林中行进很慢。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]（在某科目、某活动中的）发展
meanCollection.englishMeaning: An advance in a particular subject or activity is progress in understanding it or in doing it well.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Air safety has not improved since the dramatic advances of the the twentieth century.
senCollection.sTranslation: 飞行安全自从20世纪70年代的急剧发展以来还没有得到改善。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If something is an advance on what was previously available or done, it is better in some way.

senCollection.sentenceEn: This could be an advance on the present situation.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这可能是对目前情况的一次改善。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:advanced|过去分词:advanced|现在分词:advancing|第三人称单数:advances

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital.
senCollection.sTranslation: 来自乍得的报导指出叛军正在向首都挺进。

senCollection.sentenceEn: According to one report, the water is advancing at a rate of between 8 and 10 inches a day.
senCollection.sTranslation: 根据一份报告，大水在以每天8至10英寸的速度逼近。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The officer directed them to advance.
senCollection.sTranslation: 指挥官命令他们前进。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To advance means to make progress, especially in your knowledge of something.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Medical technology has advanced considerably.
senCollection.sTranslation: 医学技术已大大发展了。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vt. 提前借（一笔钱给某人），提前付（一笔钱给某人）
meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you advance someone a sum of money, you lend it to them, or pay it to them earlier than arranged.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I advanced him some money, which he would repay on our way home.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我先借了些钱给他，他会在回家的路上还给我。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Too much protein in the diet may advance the aging process.
senCollection.sTranslation: 饮食中过多的蛋白质会使衰老的过程提前。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful.

senCollection.sentenceEn: When not producing art of his own, Oliver was busy advancing the work of others.
senCollection.sTranslation: 没有创作自己的艺术品时，奥利弗就在忙于促成他人的作品。

senCollection.sentenceEn: That pact didn't advance peace among nations.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这一公约并没有促进国际和平。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The president has done his utmost to advance the national interest.
senCollection.sTranslation: 总统已尽了最大努力来增进国家的利益。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]事先的（预定、通知、警告等）
meanCollection.englishMeaning: Advance booking, notice, or warning is done or given before an event happens.

senCollection.sentenceEn: They don't normally give any advance notice about which building they're going to inspect.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们对要视察哪座大楼通常不作事先通知。

senCollection.sentenceEn: There was no advance warning before the eartaquhke hit.
senCollection.sTranslation: 地震之前没有任何预兆。

senCollection.sentenceEn: It is a popular show, so advance booking is essential.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这是个很受欢迎的演出，所以一定要提前订票。

Data.cxSPmean: 挑战，挑战性;质疑;质疑;向…发出挑战;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:challenges

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A challenge is something new and difficult which requires great effort and determination.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The new government's first challenge is the economy.
senCollection.sTranslation: 新政府面临的第一项挑战是经济。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He accepted his friend's challenge to swim across the river.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他接受朋友提出的挑战，游过这条河。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The crossing of this dangerous river was a challenge to most of us.
senCollection.sTranslation: 对我们大多数人来说，横渡这条充满危险的大河确实是个挑战。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A challenge to something is a questioning of its truth or value. A challenge to someone is a questioning of their authority.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The demonstrators have now made a direct challenge to the authority of the government.
senCollection.sTranslation: 示威者现已对该政府的权威性提出了直截了当的质疑。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:challenged|过去分词:challenged|现在分词:challenging|第三人称单数:challenges

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you challenge ideas or people, you question their truth, value, or authority.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Democratic leaders have challenged the president to sign the bill.
senCollection.sTranslation: 民主党领导人对总统签署这项法案存有质疑。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The move was immediately challenged by two of the republics.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这项提案立即遭到了这两个共和国的质疑。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you challenge someone, you invite them to fight or compete with you in some way.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Marsyas thought he could play the flute better than Apollo and challenged the god to a contest.
senCollection.sTranslation: 玛息阿觉得他长笛吹得比阿波罗好，便向这位神发出挑战。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He left a note at the scene of the crime, challenging detectives to catch him.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他在作案现场留了一张纸条，挑衅侦探们去抓他。

Data.cxSPmean: 权利，所有权;索要，要求;声称;索要;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:claims

meanCollection.englishMeaning: right to sth.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He released his claim to the property.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他放弃了对财产的所有权。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He decided to resign his claim to the copyright.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他决定放弃对版权的所有权。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He came and staked out a claim to the land.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他来提出要求说那块地应归他所有。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: a demand or request

senCollection.sentenceEn: He came and staked out a claim to the land.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他来提出要求说那块地应归他占有。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I want to put in a claim for damages.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我想提出赔偿损失的要求。

senCollection.sentenceEn: His claim is that he has to have that house.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的要求是他必须得到那房子

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A claim is something which someone says which they cannot prove and which may be false.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He repeated his claim that the people of Trinidad and Tobago backed his action.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他再三重复他所声称的：特立尼达和多巴哥的人民支持他的行动。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A claim is a demand for something that you think you have a right to.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Rival claims to Macedonian territory caused conflict in the Balkans.
senCollection.sTranslation: 对马其顿领土的争夺导致了巴尔干地区的冲突

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you have a claim on someone or their attention, you have the right to demand things from them or to demand their attention.

senCollection.sentenceEn: She had no claims on him now.
senCollection.sTranslation: 现在她无权向他索取什么了。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:claimed|过去分词:claimed|现在分词:claiming|第三人称单数:claims

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他声称这完全是一个针对他的阴谋。

senCollection.sentenceEn: A man claiming to be a journalist threatened to reveal details about her private life.
senCollection.sTranslation: 一个自称是记者的男人威胁要公开她的私生活细节。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The company claims that their product "makes you thin without dieting".
senCollection.sTranslation: 这家公司声称他们的产品“让你不用节食就瘦下来”。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vt. 声称（对某事负责或应得荣誉）
meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you say that someone claims responsibility or credit for something, you mean they say that they are responsible for it, but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

senCollection.sentenceEn: An underground organization has claimed responsibility for the bomb explosion.
senCollection.sTranslation: 一个地下组织已声称对炸弹爆炸事件负责。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you claim something, you try to get it because you think you have a right to it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Now they are returning to claim what was theirs.
senCollection.sTranslation: 现在他们回来索要原本属于他们的东西。

senCollection.sentenceEn: After the Duke's death, his eldest son claimed the title.
senCollection.sTranslation: 公爵死后，其长子要求继承爵位。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Have you claimed the insurance yet?
senCollection.sTranslation: 你索取保险金了吗？

senCollection.sentenceEn: The union claimed a raise worth four times the rate of inflation.
senCollection.sTranslation: 工会要求增长4倍于通货膨胀率的工资。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If someone claims a record, title, or prize, they gain or win it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Zhuang claimed the record in fifty-four seconds.
senCollection.sTranslation: 庄创造了54秒的纪录。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If something or someone claims your attention, they need you to spend your time and effort on them.

senCollection.sentenceEn: There is already a long list of people claiming her attention.
senCollection.sTranslation: 已经有太多人需要她的关注了。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you claim money from the government, an insurance company, or another organization, you officially apply to them for it, because you think you are entitled to it according to their rules.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Some 25 percent of the people who are entitled to claim benefits do not do so.
senCollection.sTranslation: 大约25%有资格索赔的人没有那样做。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you say that a war, disease, or accident claims someone's life, you mean that they are killed in it or by it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The civil war claimed the life of a U.N. interpreter yesterday.
senCollection.sTranslation: 昨天内战夺走了一位联合国译员的生命。

Data.cxSPmean: 活动、运动或进展的）中止，终止;使停住，停住;使完全停止，完全停止;尤指逻辑或诗韵）有缺陷，不流畅;

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [大纲]（活动、运动或进展的）中止，终止
meanCollection.englishMeaning: an interruption or end to activity, movement, or progress

senCollection.sentenceEn: He tried to bring that debate to a halt.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他试图使这场辩论停止。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The officer called a halt to attacks.
senCollection.sTranslation: 那个军官下令停止进攻。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The thought brought her to an abrupt halt.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她一想到这个便猛地停下了。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:halted|过去分词:halted|现在分词:halting|第三人称单数:halts

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When a person or a vehicle halts or when something halts them, they stop moving in the direction they were going and stand still.

senCollection.sentenceEn: They halted at a short distance from the house.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们停在离房子不远处。

senCollection.sentenceEn: No one can halt the advance of history.
senCollection.sTranslation: 谁也阻挡不了历史的前进。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The soldiers halted for a rest.
senCollection.sTranslation: 士兵们停下来休息。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When something such as growth, development, or activity halts or when you halt it, it stops completely.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Striking workers halted production at the auto plant yesterday.
senCollection.sTranslation: 昨天，汽车厂的罢工工人完全停止了生产。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]（尤指逻辑或诗韵）有缺陷，不流畅
meanCollection.englishMeaning: (esp of logic or verse) to falter or be defective

senCollection.sentenceEn: He never halts in his speech.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他说话从不吞吞吐吐。

Data.cxSPmean: 简便;舒适，悠闲;减轻，减缓;小心缓慢移动;

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:eased|过去分词:eased|现在分词:easing|第三人称单数:eases

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you talk about the ease of a particular activity, you are referring to the way that it has been made easier to do, or to the fact that it is already easy to do.

senCollection.sentenceEn: For ease of reference, only the relevant extracts of the regulations are included.
senCollection.sTranslation: 为便于参阅，只收录了相关条例的摘录。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Ease is the state of being very comfortable and able to live as you want, without any worries or problems.

senCollection.sentenceEn: She lived a life of ease.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她过着悠闲自在的生活。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If something unpleasant eases or if you ease it, it is reduced in degree, speed, or intensity.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Tensions had eased.
senCollection.sTranslation: 紧张缓解了。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I gave him some brandy to ease the pain.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我给了他一些白兰地以减轻疼痛。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The pain began to ease up after she was given a sedative.
senCollection.sTranslation: 给她吃了一片镇痛药后，她的疼痛开始减轻。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you ease your way somewhere or ease somewhere, you move there slowly, carefully, and gently. If you ease something somewhere, you move it there slowly, carefully, and gently.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I eased my way toward the door.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我缓慢地向门口走去。

Data.cxSPmean: 故意的）伤害;损害;故意地）伤害;损害;

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Harm is physical injury to a person or an animal which is usually caused on purpose.

senCollection.sentenceEn: All dogs are capable of doing harm to human beings.
senCollection.sTranslation: 所有的狗都能对人造成伤害。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The army defends the people from harm.
senCollection.sTranslation: 军队保护人民免遭伤害。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Don't upset yourself. No harm has been done.
senCollection.sTranslation: 不要难过——并没有造成伤害。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Harm is the damage to something which is caused by a particular course of action.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The abuse of your powers does harm to all other officers who do their job properly.
senCollection.sTranslation: 你滥用权力有损于所有其他好好工作的政府官员。

senCollection.sentenceEn: His failures did his reputation a lot of harm.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他屡次失败使他的声誉受到很大损害。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Excessive drinking did harm to his health.
senCollection.sTranslation: 过量饮酒损害了他的健康。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:harmed|过去分词:harmed|现在分词:harming|第三人称单数:harming

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To harm a person or animal means to cause them physical injury, usually on purpose.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The hijackers seemed anxious not to harm anyone.
senCollection.sTranslation: 劫机犯们似乎并不急于伤害任何人。

senCollection.sentenceEn: We little believed that he would harm us.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我们一点也不相信他会伤害我们。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I won't harm you if you let me talk.
senCollection.sTranslation: 只要你让我谈，我就不伤害你。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To harm a thing, or sometimes a person, means to damage them or make them less effective or successful than they were.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The product may harm the environment.
senCollection.sTranslation: 该产品可能会破坏环境。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Don't harm your eyes by readnig in dim light.
senCollection.sTranslation: 不要在昏暗的灯光下看书，以免损害眼睛。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Will this cleaning fluid harm the furniture?
senCollection.sTranslation: 这种清洁剂会损害家俱吗？

Data.cxSPmean: 折衷，妥协;妥协;使（自己、自己的信念）降格，危及信誉，遭到损害;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:compromises

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A compromise is a situation in which people accept something slightly different from what they really want, because of circumstances or because they are considering the wishes of other people.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Encourage your child to reach a compromise between what he wants and what you want.
senCollection.sTranslation: 鼓励你的孩子在他想要的和你想要的之间折衷。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He did it without compromise of his dignity.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他做这事而不损及他的尊严。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。

senCollection.sentenceEn: After some discussion we arrive at a compromise.
senCollection.sTranslation: 经过一番讨论之后，我们达成一项折衷方案。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:compromised|过去分词:compromised|现在分词:compromising|第三人称单数:compromises

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you compromise with someone, you reach an agreement with them in which you both give up something that you originally wanted. You can also say that two people or groups compromise.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The government has compromised with its critics over monetary policies.
senCollection.sTranslation: 政府已经在货币政策上与其批评者们有了妥协。

senCollection.sentenceEn: "Nine," I said. "Nine thirty," he replied. We compromised on 9:15.
senCollection.sTranslation: “9点，”我说。“9：30，”他回答道。我们各让一步定在9：15。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Israel had originally wanted $1 billion in aid, but compromised on the $650 million.
senCollection.sTranslation: 以色列原本想要获得10亿美元的援助，但后来作出让步，同意接受6.5亿的援助。

senCollection.sentenceEn: It's a pity if we can not compromise on it.
senCollection.sTranslation: 如果我们不能在这点上互相让步，那太可惜了。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He did not compromise in the least on this matter.
senCollection.sTranslation: 在这件事上，他一点也不妥协。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [大纲]vt. 使（自己、自己的信念）降格，危及信誉，遭到损害[表不满]
meanCollection.englishMeaning: to expose or make liable to danger, suspicion, or disrepute

senCollection.sentenceEn: Some members of the government have compromised themselves by accepting bribes.
senCollection.sTranslation: 一些政府成员们收受贿赂而使其声誉受损的。

senCollection.sentenceEn: With this increased awareness, attackers are finding it more difficult to compromise systems at the network level.
senCollection.sTranslation: 由于对这些认识得越来越清楚，攻击者发现在网络级上危害系统更加困难。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He refuses to compromise his ideals.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他拒绝放弃自己的理想。

senCollection.sentenceEn: You may be sure I will not compromise you.
senCollection.sTranslation: 您可以相信，我不会使您受到损害的。

Data.cxSPmean: 估计;判断;估价;估计;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:estimates

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An estimate is an approximate calculation of a quantity or value.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I hadn't been far wrong in my estimate.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我过去的估计大致正确。

senCollection.sentenceEn: This is a safe estimate.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这是个有把握的估计。

senCollection.sentenceEn: We need to make an accurate estimate beforehand.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我们需要事先作出准确的估计。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An estimate is a judgment about a person or situation that you make based on the available evidence.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I hadn't been far wrong in my estimate of his grandson's capabilities.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我对他孙子能力的判断没有太离谱。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An estimate from someone who you employ to do a job for you, such as a builder or a plumber, is a written statement of how much the job is likely to cost.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Quotes and estimates can be prepared by computer on the spot.
senCollection.sTranslation: 报价和估价可以当场用电脑做出来。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:estimated|过去分词:estimated|现在分词:estimating|第三人称单数:estimates

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you estimate a quantity or value, you make an approximate judgment or calculation of it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
senCollection.sTranslation: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I estimate that total cost for treatment will go from 9,000 dollars to 12,500 dollars.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我估计治疗费总额将在9千美元到1.25万美元之间。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I estimate it will take three months to build the bridge.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我估计建造这座桥得用3个月时间。

Data.cxSPmean: 进行实施;某人在某情形中的）行为方式;组织并实施;以某种方式）表现;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:conducts

meanCollection.englishMeaning: The conduct of a task or activity is the way in which it is organized and carried out.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Also up for discussion will be the conduct of free and fair elections.
senCollection.sTranslation: 还需讨论的是公平自由的选举如何进行。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他][U]（某人在某情形中的）行为方式
meanCollection.englishMeaning: Someone's conduct is the way they behave in particular situations.

senCollection.sentenceEn: For Europeans, the law is a statement of basic principles of civilized conduct.
senCollection.sTranslation: 对欧洲人来说，该法律是对基本文明行为原则的表述。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:conducted|过去分词:conducted|现在分词:conducting|第三人称单数:conducts

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When you conduct an activity or task, you organize it and do it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I decided to conduct an experiment.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我决定做一项实验。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you conduct yourself in a particular way, you behave in that way.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The way he conducts himself reflects on the family.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的行为方式折射出他的家庭。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When someone conducts an orchestra or choir, they stand in front of it and direct its performance.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Dennis had recently begun a successful career conducting opera.
senCollection.sTranslation: 丹尼斯最近成功地开始了指挥歌剧的生涯。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Solti continued to conduct here and abroad.
senCollection.sTranslation: 佐尔蒂继续在国内外指挥。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If something conducts heat or electricity, it allows heat or electricity to pass through it or along it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Water conducts heat faster than air.
senCollection.sTranslation: 水比空气导热快。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: lead or guide

senCollection.sentenceEn: The guide conducted us around the ruins of the ancient city.
senCollection.sTranslation: 导游引导我们游览了古城废墟。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The visitors were conducted over the factory.
senCollection.sTranslation: 参观者被引导到工厂的各处去参观。

senCollection.sentenceEn: They hired agents to conduct their company.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们雇请代理人来带领他们的公司。

Data.cxSPmean: 行使，运用;锻炼;军事）演习;练习;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:exercises

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An act of employing or putting into play; use

senCollection.sentenceEn: Social structures are maintained through the exercise of political and economic power.
senCollection.sTranslation: 社会结构是通过政治和经济权力的运用来维护的。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Exercises are a series of movements or actions that you do in order to get in shape, remain healthy, or practise for a particular physical activity.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I do special neck and shoulder exercises.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我做专门针对颈部与肩部的锻炼。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Exercise is good for your heart and lungs.
senCollection.sTranslation: 对您的心脏和肺，运动也是有益的。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I suggest you go on a diet and take more exercise.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我建议你节食，多做运动。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Exercises are military activities and operations that are not part of a real war, but that allow the armed forces to practise for a real war.

senCollection.sentenceEn: General Powell predicted that in the future it might even be possible to stage joint military exercises.
senCollection.sTranslation: 鲍威尔将军预言将来甚至可能举行联合军事演习。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An exercise is a short activity or piece of work that you do, in school for example, which is designed to help you learn a particular skill.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Try working through the opening exercises in this chapter.
senCollection.sTranslation: 努力完成本章开头部分的各个练习。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The pupil's exercise was full of erasures.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这个学生的作业练习到处都是擦拭的痕迹。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Should I hand in my exercise book tomorrow?
senCollection.sTranslation: 我是否该明天交作业？

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:exercised|过去分词:exercised|现在分词:exercising|第三人称单数:exercises

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you exercise something such as your authority, your rights, or a good quality, you use it or put it into effect.

senCollection.sentenceEn: They are merely exercising their right to free speech.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们仅仅是在行使言论自由的权利。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When you exercise, you move your body energetically in order to get in shape and to remain healthy.

senCollection.sentenceEn: She exercises two or three times a week.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她一周锻炼两三次。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I find it really hard to drag myself out and exercise regularly.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我发现要让我自己定期出门锻炼真的很难。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Every day I exercise before I go to sleep.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我每天睡觉前锻炼。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vt. 锻炼（身体某一部位）
meanCollection.englishMeaning: If a movement or activity exercises a part of your body, it keeps it strong, healthy, or in good condition.

senCollection.sentenceEn: They call rowing the perfect sport. It exercises every major muscle group.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们把划船称之为完美的运动。它锻炼身体的各主要肌肉群。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vt. 使某人/某物得到锻炼或训练
meanCollection.englishMeaning: give exerciseto sb./sth.; train sb./sth.(by means of exercises)

senCollection.sentenceEn: Horses get fat and lazy if they are not exercised.
senCollection.sTranslation: 马不训练就会增膘﹑ 变懒。

Data.cxSPmean: 焦点;诉求点;焦点，对焦;关注;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:foci/focuses

meanCollection.englishMeaning: The focus of something is the main topic or main thing that it is concerned with.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The UN's role in promoting peace is increasingly the focus of international attention.
senCollection.sTranslation: 联合国在促进和平方面的作用越来越成为国际关注的焦点。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The new system is the focus of controversy.
senCollection.sTranslation: 新系统是争议的焦点。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The main focus of this manual is the management of fresh ground water resources.
senCollection.sTranslation: 本指南的主要中心是地下淡水资源的管理。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you say that something has a focus, you mean that you can see a purpose in it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Somehow, though, their latest CD has a focus that the others have lacked.
senCollection.sTranslation: 但是，不管怎么说，他们的最新激光唱片具备别人没有的诉求点。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: You use focus to refer to the fact of adjusting your eyes or a camera, telescope, or other instrument, and to the degree to which you can see clearly.

senCollection.sentenceEn: His focus switched to the little white ball.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的焦点转移到了那个小白球上。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:focused|过去分词:focused|现在分词:focusing|第三人称单数:focuses

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you focus on a particular topic or if your attention is focused on it, you concentrate on it and think about it, discuss it, or deal with it, rather than dealing with other topics.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The research effort has focused on tracing the effects of growing levels of five compounds.
senCollection.sTranslation: 研究集中跟踪5种化合物水平上升带来的影响。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]使（眼睛、相机、望远镜或其它仪器）对焦，聚焦
meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you focus your eyes or if your eyes focus, your eyes adjust so that you can clearly see the thing that you want to look at. If you focus a camera, telescope, or other instrument, you adjust it so that you can see clearly through it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Kelly couldn't focus his eyes well enough to tell if the figure was male or female.
senCollection.sTranslation: 凯利无法看清那个人影是男的还是女的。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you focus rays of light on a particular point, you pass them through a lens or reflect them from a mirror so that they meet at that point.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Magnetic coils focus the electron beams into fine spots.
senCollection.sTranslation: 磁线圈将电子束聚焦成细小的点。

Data.cxSPmean: 增加;腰槽;获得物，获得;获得;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:gains

meanCollection.englishMeaning: an increase in amount or degree

senCollection.sentenceEn: News on new home sales is brighter, showing a gain of nearly 8 percent in June.
senCollection.sTranslation: 有关新房销售的新闻更加乐观，显示6月份有近8%的增长。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: a notch, mortise, or groove, esp one cut to take the flap of a butt hinge

senCollection.sentenceEn: Please join by or fit into a gain.
senCollection.sTranslation: 请在腰槽内连接或配合。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: something gained or acquired, or the act of acquiring

senCollection.sentenceEn: No pain, no gain.
senCollection.sTranslation: 不劳则无获。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:gained|过去分词:gained|现在分词:gaining|第三人称单数:gains

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If a person or place gains something such as an ability or quality, they gradually get more of it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Students can gain valuable experience by working on the campus radio or magazine.
senCollection.sTranslation: 学生们通过在校园广播台或校刊工作能够获得宝贵的经验。

senCollection.sentenceEn: His reputation abroad has gained in stature.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他在国外的声望提高了档次。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I did not gain very much by my inspection.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我这样细看一番收获并不太大。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you gain from something such as an event or situation, you get some advantage or benefit from it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The company didn't disclose how much it expects to gain from the two deals.
senCollection.sTranslation: 该公司没有透露它期望从这两笔交易中获利多少。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To gain something such as weight or speed means to have an increase in that particular thing.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Some people do gain weight after they stop smoking.
senCollection.sTranslation: 有些人戒烟后的确增加体重了。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Our main objective must be to gain market share, and to do this we must increase our sales.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我们的主要目的应该是增加市场的份额，为此，我们必须增加销售。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Much as I hope I may gain weight, I am still as thin as before.
senCollection.sTranslation: 虽然我非常希望增加体重，但我仍然像以前一样的瘦。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you gain something, you obtain it, especially after a lot of hard work or effort.

senCollection.sentenceEn: To gain a promotion, you might have to work overtime.
senCollection.sTranslation: 为了得到晋升，你可能得加班。

senCollection.sentenceEn: They gain in security what they lose in liberty.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们从安全中得到了他们在自由中所失去的东西。

senCollection.sentenceEn: You will gain experience if nothing more in that job.
senCollection.sTranslation: 如果这个工作没什么突出的，你至少可以获得经验。

Data.cxSPmean: 器具;实施，执行;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:implements

meanCollection.englishMeaning: An implement is a tool or other piece of equipment.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I purchased some writing implements.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我买了些书写用具。

senCollection.sentenceEn: What implements are needed for gardening?
senCollection.sTranslation: 园艺需要些什么工具？

senCollection.sentenceEn: That implement is useful for many purposes in the kitchen.
senCollection.sTranslation: 那种工具在厨房里有许多用途。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:implemented|过去分词:implemented|现在分词:implementing|第三人称单数:implements

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you implement something such as a plan, you ensure that what has been planned is done.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The government promised to implement a new system to control financial loan institutions.
senCollection.sTranslation: 政府许诺要实施新的制度来控制金融贷款机构。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Her designs will be put on ice until money is available to implement them.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她的设计将暂时搁起来，等有了钱再去实施。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The government is implementing a new policy to help the unemployed.
senCollection.sTranslation: 政府正在实施一项新的帮助失业者的政策。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The committee's decisions will be implemented immediately.
senCollection.sTranslation: 委员会的决定将立即执行。

senCollection.sentenceEn: It is not the proper way to implement a policy by force.
senCollection.sTranslation: 强迫推行一项政策不是办法。

Data.cxSPmean: 职位，级别，军衔;尤指较高的）社会地位;成员;普通成员（尤指军队的普通士兵）;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:ranks

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Someone's rank is the position or grade that they have in an organization.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He eventually rose to the rank of captain.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他最终升到了船长的职位。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He is above me in rank.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的级别我比高。

senCollection.sentenceEn: They are people of all ranks and classes.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们来自各阶层各阶级。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]（尤指较高的）社会地位<正式>
meanCollection.englishMeaning: Someone's rank is the social class, especially the high social class, that they belong to.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He must be treated as a hostage of high rank, not as a common prisoner.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他一定要作为一个高级人质而不是一般囚徒来对待。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: The ranks of a group or organization are the people who belong to it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: There were some misgivings within the ranks of the media too.
senCollection.sTranslation: 媒体内部成员也有一些担忧。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]普通成员（尤指军队的普通士兵）
meanCollection.englishMeaning: The ranks are the ordinary members of an organization, especially of the armed forces.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Most shop managers have worked their way up through the ranks.
senCollection.sTranslation: 大部分的商店经理都是从普通员工干上来的。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A rank of people or things is a row of them.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Ranks of police in riot gear stood nervously by.
senCollection.sTranslation: 一排排配有防暴设备的警察紧张地站在一边。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A taxi rank is a place on a city street where taxis park when they are available.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Luckily there was a taxi rank nearby.
senCollection.sTranslation: 幸好附近有个出租车候客处。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:ranked|过去分词:ranked|现在分词:ranking|第三人称单数:ranks

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If an official organization ranks someone or something 1st, 5th, or 50th, for example, they calculate that the person or thing has that position on a scale. You can also say that someone or something ranks 1st, 5th, or 50th, for example.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The report ranks the U.S. twentieth out of twenty-two advanced nations.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这份报告把美国排在22个发达国家的第20位。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you say that someone or something ranks high or low on a scale, you are saying how good or important you think they are.

senCollection.sentenceEn: His prices rank high among those of other contemporary photographers.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的要价与其他同时代的摄影师相比居高。

cxCollection.morphology: 比较级:ranker|最高级:rankest

meanCollection.englishMeaning: showing vigorous and profuse growth

senCollection.sentenceEn: The frank man put the first-rank blank blanket into the tan tank.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这个坦率的人把这条第一个繁茂的空白的毯子放进褐色油箱。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: highly offensive or disagreeable, esp in smell or taste

senCollection.sentenceEn: The kitchen was rank with the smell of drying uniforms.
senCollection.sTranslation: 厨房内充斥着烘干制服的难闻气味。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]完全的，绝对的，彻头彻尾的
meanCollection.englishMeaning: complete or absolute; utter

senCollection.sentenceEn: The winning horse was a rank outsider.
senCollection.sTranslation: 获胜的马是一匹完全不起眼儿的冷门马。

Data.cxSPmean: 给演员等）提示，暗示;触发事件;为下一位演员）提示;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:cues

meanCollection.englishMeaning: a word or action in a play or film, which is used as a signal by a performer to begin saying or doing something; a signal for someone to do something

senCollection.sentenceEn: The actors not performing sit at the side of the stage in full view, waiting for their cues.
senCollection.sTranslation: 未表演的男演员们坐在舞台边，对舞台一览无余，他们等待着上场的提示。

senCollection.sentenceEn: When I nod my head, that's your cue to interrupt the meeting.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我一点头，就是暗示你把会议中断。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The actor picked up his cue with effect.
senCollection.sTranslation: 演员对他所得到的提示迅速地作出了反应，效果良好。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The horses reacted as if on cue.
senCollection.sTranslation: 马像得了信号一样地起了反应。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you say that something that happens is a cue for an action, you mean that people start doing that action when it happens.

senCollection.sentenceEn: That was the cue for several months of intense bargaining.
senCollection.sTranslation: 此事触发了此后数月激烈的讨价还价。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:cued|过去分词:cued|现在分词:cueing|第三人称单数:cues

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If one performer cues another, they say or do something which is a signal for the second performer to begin speaking, playing, or doing something.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He read the scene, with Seaton cueing him.
senCollection.sTranslation: 在西顿提示下，他朗诵了这一场的台词。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Can you cue me when you want me to begin speaking?
senCollection.sTranslation: 你要我开始讲话时能给我暗示一下吗？

Data.cxSPmean: 记忆力，回忆;召回;召回;记起，回忆到;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:recalls

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Recall is the ability to remember something that has happened in the past or the act of remembering it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He had a good memory, and total recall of her spoken words.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他有好记性，能完全回忆出她说过的话。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He seemed to have a very selective recall of past events.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他好像对过去的事情有选择地回忆。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Do you mean you have the same recall as us?
senCollection.sTranslation: 你的意思是你也有跟我们一样的回忆吗？

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you are recalled to your home, country, or the place where you work, you are ordered to return there.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The recall of Ambassador Alan Green is a public signal of America's concern.
senCollection.sTranslation: 艾伦·格林大使的召回是美国关注此事的公开信号。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If a company recalls a product, it asks the shops or the people who have bought that product to return it because there is something wrong with it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: It's a recall of the laptops due to defective supply parts.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这是一次因为有缺陷的配件而对笔记本电脑的召回。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:recalled|过去分词:recalled|现在分词:recalling|第三人称单数:recalls

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When you recall something, you remember it and tell others about it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Henderson recalled that he first met Pollard during a business trip to Washington.
senCollection.sTranslation: 亨德森记起他是在一次去华盛顿出差的途中第一次与波拉德结识的。

senCollection.sentenceEn: His mother later recalled:"He used to stay up until two o'clock in the morning playing these war games."
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的母亲后来回忆道：“他过去常常熬夜到凌晨2点玩这些打仗的游戏。”

senCollection.sentenceEn: I can't recall how long it has been.
senCollection.sTranslation: “他叫什么名字？”—“我想不起来了。”

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you are recalled to your home, country, or the place where you work, you are ordered to return there.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The U.S. envoy was recalled to Washington.
senCollection.sTranslation: 该美国特使被召回了华盛顿。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If a company recalls a product, it asks the stores or the people who have bought that product to return it because there is something wrong with it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The company said it was recalling one of its drugs and had stopped selling two others.
senCollection.sTranslation: 该公司说它正在召回它的一种药品，而且已经停售了另外两种药品。

Data.cxSPmean: 草稿，初稿;汇票;钻进某处的）风;征兵;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:drafts

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A draft is an early version of a letter, book, or speech.

senCollection.sentenceEn: I rewrote his rough draft, which was published under my name.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我改写了他那篇以我的名义发表了的初稿。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I faxed a first draft of this article to him.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我把这篇文章的初稿传真给他。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He drew a draft of the car.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他画了一张汽车的草图。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A draft is a written order for payment of money by a bank, especially from one bank to another.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Payments must be made in U.S. dollars by a bank draft drawn to the order of the United Nations Postal Administration.
senCollection.sTranslation: 付款必须用开给联合国邮政管理处的银行汇票，并以美元支付。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A draft is a current of air that comes into a place in an undesirable way.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Block drafts around doors and windows.
senCollection.sTranslation: 挡住门窗周围的风。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: The draft is the practice of ordering people to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Use of the draft as a form of punishment has struck a sour note in some quarters.
senCollection.sTranslation: 将征兵作为一种惩罚手段的做法在一些地区引起了反感。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:drafted|过去分词:drafted|现在分词:drafting|第三人称单数:drafts

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When you draft a letter, book, or speech, you write the first version of it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: He drafted a letter to the editors.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他草拟了一封给编辑的信。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you are drafted, you are ordered to serve in the armed forces, usually for a limited period of time.

senCollection.sentenceEn: During the Second World War, he was drafted into the U.S. Army.
senCollection.sTranslation: 第二次世界大战期间，他应征加入美国陆军。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: To select from a group for some usually compulsory service

senCollection.sentenceEn: She hoped that Fox could be drafted to run the organization.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她希望福克斯能够被选派来掌管这个组织。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]适于或用于牵引重物的
meanCollection.englishMeaning: Suited for or used for drawing heavy loads

senCollection.sentenceEn: Oxen and other draft animals are very useful in daily life.
senCollection.sTranslation: 牛和其它牵引重物的动物在生活中很有用。

Data.cxSPmean: 保证;保修单;担保物;保证;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:guarantees

meanCollection.englishMeaning: Something that is a guarantee of something else makes it certain that it will happen or that it is true.

senCollection.sentenceEn: A famous old name on a firm is not necessarily a guarantee of quality.
senCollection.sTranslation: 公司的老字号并不一定能保证质量。

senCollection.sentenceEn: A diploma is no guarantee of efficiency.
senCollection.sTranslation: 持有文凭不能保证工作效率一定高。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The vigorous pursuit of policies is no guarantee of success.
senCollection.sTranslation: 坚决贯彻方针政策并不能保证成功。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A guarantee is a written promise by a company to replace or repair a product free of charge if it has any faults within a particular time.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Whatever a guarantee says, when something goes wrong, you can still claim your rights from the shop.
senCollection.sTranslation: 不管保修单上怎么说，当产品出现故障时，你仍然可以去商店维护自身的权益。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A guarantee is money or something valuable that you give to someone to show that you will do what you have promised.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Males between 18 and 20 had to leave a deposit as a guarantee of returning to do their military service.
senCollection.sTranslation: 18岁至20岁的男性必须留下押金作为回来服兵役的担保。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: a pledge that something will be performed in a specified manner

senCollection.sentenceEn: California's state Constitution includes a guarantee of privacy.
senCollection.sTranslation: 加利福尼亚的州宪法涵盖对隐私权的保障。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The Editor can give no guarantee that they will fulfil their obligations.
senCollection.sTranslation: 《编辑家》无法保证他们会履行职责。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Can you give me your guarantee that the goods will be delivered before Friday?
senCollection.sTranslation: 你能给我保证这批货在星期五之前交货吗？

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:guaranteed|过去分词:guaranteed|现在分词:guaranteeing|第三人称单数:guarantees

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If one thing guarantees another, the first is certain to cause the second thing to happen.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Surplus resources alone do not guarantee growth.
senCollection.sTranslation: 仅有富足的资源并不能确保发展。

senCollection.sentenceEn: His fame guarantees that his calls will nearly always be returned.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他的名望确保他的呼吁几乎总能得到回应。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Preparation will guarantee success!
senCollection.sTranslation: 准备充分将确保成功！

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vt. 保证…必定发生，保证…做某事或提供某物
meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you guarantee something, you promise that it will definitely happen, or that you will do or provide it for someone.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Most states guarantee the right to free and adequate education.
senCollection.sTranslation: 大多数州都保证免费和适当教育的权利。

senCollection.sentenceEn: We guarantee the fastness of these dyes.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我们保证这些染料不褪色。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Will you guarantee us regular employment?
senCollection.sTranslation: 你愿意保证定期雇用我们吗？

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vt. 为…提供质量保证，担保
meanCollection.englishMeaning: If a company guarantees its product or work, they provide a guarantee for it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Some builders guarantee their work.
senCollection.sTranslation: 一些建筑公司对其承建工程提供质量保证。

senCollection.sentenceEn: All Dreamland's electric blankets are guaranteed for three years.
senCollection.sTranslation: 所有的梦乡牌电热毯质保3年。

Data.cxSPmean: 少许;痕迹，踪迹;追溯;找到;

cxCollection.morphology: 复数:traces

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A trace of something is a very small amount of it.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Wash them in cold water to remove all traces of sand.
senCollection.sTranslation: 用冷水清洗它们以清除所有的沙子。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Meat which has been cooked thoroughly shows no traces of pinkness.
senCollection.sTranslation: 彻底煮熟的肉不会带有血色。

senCollection.sentenceEn: There are traces of poison in the fish.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这种鱼体内有微量的毒素。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: mark, track, sign, etc. showing what has existed or happened

senCollection.sentenceEn: When the police exhume the corpse they discover trace of poison in it.
senCollection.sTranslation: 警方掘出尸体，发现有中毒的痕迹。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The police have detected the trace of the murderer after several days of investigation.
senCollection.sTranslation: 警察经过几天的调查，发现了凶手的踪迹。

senCollection.sentenceEn: There's been no trace of my aunt and uncle.
senCollection.sTranslation: 没有我姑姑、姑夫的踪迹。

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:traced|过去分词:traced|现在分词:tracing|第三人称单数:traces

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you trace the origin or development of something, you find out or describe how it started or developed.

senCollection.sentenceEn: The exhibition traces the history of graphic design in America from the nineteenth century to the present.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这个展览会追溯了从19世纪到现在美国平面设计的历史。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He traces his descent back to an old norman family.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他追踪自己的世系上溯至一个古老的诺曼家族。

senCollection.sentenceEn: The custom traces to the time of the Warring States.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这个风俗可上溯到战国时代。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If you trace someone or something, you find them after looking for them.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Police are anxious to trace two men seen leaving the house just before 8am.
senCollection.sTranslation: 警察急切想找到在接近早晨8点前被人看到离开那幢房子的两名男子。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I have nothing to trace.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我没找到任何东西。

senCollection.sentenceEn: They could not trace him.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们找不到他。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: sketch or indicate the outline of sth.

senCollection.sentenceEn: She learned to draw by tracing pictures out of old storybooks.
senCollection.sTranslation: 她通过描摹旧故事书上的图画来学绘画。

senCollection.sentenceEn: I traced the course of the river on the map spread out on my briefcase.
senCollection.sTranslation: 我在自己公文包上铺展开的地图中勾画出了这条河的流向。

senCollection.sentenceEn: He wanted to trace roughly.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他想草草地勾画。

Data.cxSPmean: 使褪色，褪色;逐渐变暗，逐渐变弱;逐渐变弱;淡出;

cxCollection.morphology: 过去式:faded|过去分词:faded|现在分词:fading|第三人称单数:fades

meanCollection.englishMeaning: When a coloured object fades or when the light fades it, it gradually becomes paler.

senCollection.sentenceEn: All colour fades, especially under the impact of direct sunlight.
senCollection.sTranslation: 所有颜色都会褪色——尤其是在直射阳光的影响下。

senCollection.sentenceEn: No matter how soft the light is, it still fades carpets and curtains in every room.
senCollection.sTranslation: 不论光线多么柔和，它仍然会使每个房间的地毯和窗帘褪色。

senCollection.sentenceEn: These sunproof curtains will not fade.
senCollection.sTranslation: 这些耐晒的窗帘不褪色。

meanCollection.chineseMeaning: [其他]vi. 逐渐变暗，逐渐变弱
meanCollection.englishMeaning: When light fades, it slowly becomes less bright. When a sound fades, it slowly becomes less loud.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Seaton lay on his bed and gazed at the ceiling as the light faded.
senCollection.sTranslation: 西顿躺在床上凝视着天花板，那时光线逐渐变暗。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: If memories, feelings, or possibilities fade, they slowly become less intense or less strong.

senCollection.sentenceEn: Sympathy for the rebels, the government claims, is beginning to fade.
senCollection.sTranslation: 政府声称对造反者的同情在开始减弱。

senCollection.sentenceEn: Prospects for peace had already started to fade.
senCollection.sTranslation: 和平的前景已开始变得暗淡。

meanCollection.englishMeaning: A gradual diminution in the brightness or visibility of an image in cinema or television

senCollection.sentenceEn: They do not know what cause the fade of the TV.
senCollection.sTranslation: 他们不明白为什么电视画面会淡化。
